author: Staff Reporter
text:
Days after the attack on a police station in Malda district during a rally of a minority organisation, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said “local problems cannot be linked to communal tension.”

She, however, did not mention the incident.

Her comments come on a day when the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) demanded that the State government publish a ‘White Paper’ on the incident.

“A police station was set ablaze in an area like Kaliachak where opium smuggling and printing of fake Indian currency notes take place. The State government should immediately seek a report from the Superintendent of Police concerned,” RSS West Bengal unit secretary Jishnu Basu said here on Friday.

‘Were case diaries burnt?’

Criticising the Trinamool Congress for not “doing enough” on the issue, Mr. Basu also said the report should mention how many firearms were stolen from the police station and how many case diaries burnt.

‘Kaliachak attack is tantamount to waging war against the state’
title: Mamata govt. not doing enough in Malda case: RSS
